text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so 
Valentine's Day is coming up in just a few days

and if you're cooking a special dinner for someone 
then I've got a great dessert recipe for you that

you can actually make a day in advance you don't 
have to worry about it the day off so we're making

black sticky rice Sunday and it's something that 
I created by combining two different traditional

recipes black sticky rice pudding and coconut ice 
cream with sticky rice it's going to be so good

and it's going to be super unique too so let's get 
started all right so this dessert is going to be

a layer of black sticky rice pudding this thick 
and luscious caramelized pineapple and coconut

ice cream on top so we're going to start with the 
black sticky rice pudding first so I've got two

types of rice here I've got Thai black sticky rice 
and when you buy this at the store sometimes it's

called black glutinous rice Thai black sweet rice 
so but all you're looking for is that one it's a

product of Thailand and - it's got this black 
color but it's also got some grains of brown in

it so it shouldn't be all black and I also have a 
little bit of white sticky rice get these washed

and then you want to soak them overnight it'll 
help you cook faster and your water will turn

sort of this really beautiful purple color because 
the rice is actually really dark purple it's not

actually black okay so I've got both the black and 
the white rice soaking together in here drain it

and then give it a good rinse take and the white 
rice the reason why you want to add a little bit

of white rice is it will help bind the pudding 
together because the black rice is whole-grain

that fiber on the outside is going to prevent it 
from getting creamy so the white rice once it's

cooked together to completely break down that 
it'll add that creaminess that we want for the

pudding at just 2 cups of water to this I'm going 
to add some pandan leaves now these are so this is

only a sort of half of a pandan leaf they're so 
aromatic got this beautiful floral aroma and we

used head and leaves all the time in our desserts 
it's sort of our version of vanilla you can find

this frozen at an Asian grocery store so look 
in the frozen section it's kind of optional

you can't find it it's not the end of the world 
bring this to a boil now once it comes to a boil

reduce it down to a simmer and you want to let it 
simmer for at least 30 minutes or until the rice

is completely cooked actually a little overcooked 
because we want it to be creamy and pudding like

you don't have to worry about stirring it for 
now but as soon as the rice starts to thicken

you want to be stirring because as soon as the 
starch starts coming out of the grains it's going

to want to fall to the bottom and stick and burn 
so the rice is simmering away back there and we

are going to now make caramelized pineapple and 
I'm telling you this in and of itself over ice

cream is so good so if you don't make the whole 
thing just make the pineapple you're golden so

I've got a pan here I'm going to turn it on just 
on medium heat and I'm going to add a little bit

of butter now while that's melting I've got some 
pineapple here that I've cut into small pieces I'm

using fresh for this because I really like the 
tartness that fresh pineapple has and I'm gonna

toss in some sugar about three tablespoons just 
toss all that together let's take a look at the

butter again if you notice the butter is going 
to start bubbling after it starts melting what

you want to do is wait for the bubbling to stop 
like it has because that bubbling is basically

the water that's in the butter evaporating away 
we want all the water gone then go in with the

pineapple spread the pineapple apart try to get it 
all in one layer so make sure you use a big enough

pan for it now you're going to wait until all 
that liquid evaporates and the pineapple on the

underside is going to start to brown and become 
beautiful now I have to tell you where I got the

idea of caramelized pineapple from so if you go 
to Thailand and you get one of those coconut ice

cream carts like I used to get all the time when I 
was a kid they'll have different types of toppings

to go on the coconut ice cream but sticky rice 
candied pumpkin and one of the things they have is

candied pineapple which is something that I always 
always get because just love the combination of

tart pineapple and creamy coconut enemy hello 
Pina Colada the world knows that pineapple and

coconut go super well together so be patient keep 
checking the color but just don't stir because if

you stir that's when you're you're gonna lose 
that browning so just you know if you want to

know just slip one app to see if it's brown and 
if it's not just leave it alone leave it alone

don't touch it ooh give it a quick stir and then 
toss the pineapple with that butter and turn it

off caramelized sugar browned butter oh and that 
is it so the rice has been simmering for about

15-20 minutes it's still got a ways to go as you 
can see it's still it's not creamy yet right but

I've also evaporated most of the water just add 
water so that's why you want to keep an eye on it

and if it dries up make sure you keep adding water 
but you don't want to add too much water at a time

if the rice is done and you end up with too much 
liquid then you're not going to get a thick rich

pudding then your pudding will just have a lot 
of water in it right kind of like making risotto

exactly like making a risotto I'm also going to 
take out the pandan leaves they've had plenty of

time to infuse and they just kind of get in the 
way of your stirring so I like to get rid of them

at this point so it's nice and thick and creamy 
now as you can see it's super thick and that's

what you want so I've got palm sugar here but you 
can also do brown sugar cut it with a little bit

of salt yes High Desert's is always about a little 
bit of saltiness to balance that sweet by the way

if you want to know more about traditional Thai 
desserts I just made a video when I was back in

Thailand that's a special documentary type thing 
on Thai desserts so you can check that out I'm

going to strengthen it a little bit make it even 
a little more viscous because once the ice cream

melts I find that like this it will it'll loosen 
really quickly with the melting I scream so I'm

going to add a little bit of tapioca starch I'm 
going to add just enough water to dissolve it okay

you don't add too much water now I'm going to add 
this to the rice but only half at a time because

I may not need it all now can you use corn starch 
yes you can use corn starch instead but I really

do like the consistency that tapioca starch gives 
so I've turned on the heat to cook because you

want to cook out that starch you want to bring 
this back to a boil you want the rice to start

bubbling again so I am good with that beautiful so 
everything that we've made thus far you can make

in advance even a couple of days reheat the rice 
reheat the pineapple and then just put it together

whenever you're ready the only two things that we 
haven't talked about is the garnish on top which

is some roasted peanuts so it's just classic 
on Thai coconut ice cream you go to Thailand

they'll always want to put roasted peanuts on 
your ice cream and also some coconut ice cream

now make sure you use a good brand of coconut 
ice cream I have a recipe for it but you know

if you don't want to make your own ice cream look 
at the ingredient list and make sure it doesn't

have any dairy because you want pure coconut 
flavor it should be made entirely of coconut

milk basically right Oh vessels gotta talk about 
the vessels choose something that's gonna be super

cute so I've got like a little martini glass here 
or mason jars or trendy right now so you want to

do like a mason jar sundae you can do that as well 
so it's up to you be careful not to dirty the side

as you put it down pineapple is going down hey 
ice cream time look how cute that is you know me

I always love a little crunchiness on my food 
and there you go that is a dessert to impress

so good so good got everything everything in 
here chewiness from the black rice creamy from

the coconut Hartness from the pineapple crunchy 
and nutty from the peanut and everything works

together so well oh my god I could just sit 
here and eat this all day it still got that

traditional flavor that I remember from my 
childhood I used to run after that ice cream

cart every day like I knew exactly what time it 
would come the bell would ring and I'd like run

out the door to catch them always a little bit 
of sticky rice but it would be white sticky rice

coconut candy pineapple peanuts on top that would 
be my go-to order every time and this just takes

that a step further so I hope you give this a 
try maybe for this Valentine's Day maybe for

another special occasion or maybe just keep it 
in your fridge so you can have it everyday all

right so the recipe as always is on hot Thai 
Kitchen calm and when you make it please send

me a photo and send it to me on Facebook Twitter 
or Instagram and I will see you next time for your

next delicious tightening some grains that 
are light brown it's usually you know a mmm
